name: Mental addition and subtraction with decimals 2

skills.name: Add decimals with the same number of decimals places
Add decimals where the numbers involved have a different number of decimal places

explanations.A: The easiest way to do this sum is to think of 2.5 as 2.50 so both values have the same number of decimal places. You can then subtract the units (2 - 1) and the decimal places (0.50 - 0.09)... 2.50 - 1.09 = 1.41
explanations.B: Not quite. We are subtracting 9 from 0 NOT 0 from 9. Remember to borrow if you are subtracting a larger number from a smaller number.
explanations.C: You have accidentally done the sum 2.05 - 1.09 instead of 2.5 - 1.09. The 5 is in the tenths column, not the hundredths. Think about 2.5 being the same as 2.50 then mentally you can do 2 - 1 and 0.50 - 0.09 to get your answer.
explanations.D: You have accidentally done the sum 1.09 - 0.25, we need to do 2.5 - 1.09. Think about 2.5 being the same as 2.50 then mentally you can do 2 - 1 and 0.50 - 0.09 to get your answer.
